dt: {bc}to gather, catch, hunt, or kill (salmon, oysters, deer, etc.) for human use, sport, or population control

{bc}to remove or extract (something, such as living cells, tissues, or organs) from culture {dx_def}see {dxt|culture:1||3}{/dx_def} or from a living or recently deceased body especially for transplanting

dt.t: has now {wi}harvested{/wi} this new generation's scholarly labors

dt: {bc}to gather in a crop especially for food

dt.t: sold it standing in the field to save himself the trouble of {wi}harvesting{/wi}

shortdef: to gather, catch, hunt, or kill (salmon, oysters, deer, etc.) for human use, sport, or population control
to remove or extract (something, such as living cells, tissues, or organs) from culture or from a living or recently deceased body especially for transplanting

dt: {bc}the season for gathering in agricultural crops
{bc}the act or process of gathering in a crop
{bc}a mature crop (as of grain or fruit) {bc}{sx|yield||}
{bc}the quantity of a natural product gathered in a single season

et: Middle English {it}hervest{/it}, from Old English {it}hærfest{/it}; akin to Latin {it}carpere{/it} to pluck, gather, Greek {it}karpos{/it} fruit
shortdef: the season for gathering in agricultural crops
the act or process of gathering in a crop
a mature crop (as of grain or fruit) : yield
